snippet: The people executed in recent years were not the “worst of the worst.” They were those who were too poor, mentally ill or disabled to avoid it.
abstract: Editorial welcomes decision by Maryland Gov Martin O'Malley to commute death sentences of final four inmates on death row in state; cites move as example of rapidly shifting debate on death penalty, which is opposed by liberals and a growing number of conservatives on various grounds; warns while opinion is changing, those who continue to be executed are often those who are too poor, mentally ill or disabled to fight their sentences.
lead_paragraph: The people executed in recent years were not the “worst of the worst.” They were those who were too poor, mentally ill or disabled to avoid it.

headline.main: Shifting Politics on the Death Penalty
